metadata.title: CVE-2020-36780 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: i2c:sprd: fix reference leak when pm_runtime_get_sync fails The PM referencecount is not expected to be incremented on return in sprd_i2c_master_xfer()and sprd_i2c_remove(). However, pm_runtime_get_sync will increment the PMreference count even failed. Forgetting to putting operation will result ina reference leak here. Replace it with pm_runtime_resume_and_get to keepusage counter balanced.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
